name: SkillsFuture SG
description: SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) drives and coordinates the implementation of the national SkillsFuture movement, promotes a culture and holistic system of lifelong learning through the pursuit of skills mastery, and strengthens the ecosystem of quality education and training in Singapore. The SSG provides guidance and advice to the SSG Management on all matters under SSG’s purview, including its policy, regulatory and promotional roles. It also reviews and approves the strategic plans and budgets of SSG. The SSG Board members come from diverse backgrounds such as the unions, the private and public sectors. This allows SSG to tap on their varied experiences and perspectives.
features: Help individuals make well-informed choices in education, training and careers
Develop an integrated high-quality system of education and training that responds to constantly evolving needs
Promote employer recognition and career development based on skills and mastery
business_objectives: Accelerate Skill Development and Learning Efficiency
Headline: SkillsFuture is a national movement to provide Singaporeans with the opportunities to develop their fullest potential throughout life, regardless of their starting points.
ShortDescription: SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) is a statutory board under the Ministry of Education (MOE) that will drive and coordinate the implementation of the national SkillsFuture movement, promote a culture of lifelong learning through the pursuit of skills mastery, and strengthening the ecosystem of quality education and training in Singapore.
enhanced_description: SkillsFuture Singapore (SSG) is a statutory board under the Ministry of Education (MOE) that spearheads the national SkillsFuture movement in Singapore. Its core mission is to foster a culture of lifelong learning and skills mastery, providing Singaporeans with continuous opportunities for development across various life stages and starting points. SSG works to strengthen and coordinate a high-quality ecosystem of education and training, ensuring it remains responsive to constantly evolving workforce needs. The initiative also aims to promote employer recognition and career progression based on skills and mastery, while guiding individuals in making well-informed choices regarding their education, training, and career paths.
key_use_cases: Enabling lifelong learning and skills mastery for individuals
Developing an integrated and high-quality national education and training system
Promoting employer recognition of skills for career development
Guiding individuals in education, training, and career choices
Accelerating skill development and learning efficiency across the workforce
competitive_advantages: Government-backed national initiative (statutory board under MOE)
Comprehensive national scope for lifelong learning and skills mastery
Diverse board representation from unions, private, and public sectors ensuring varied perspectives and holistic approach
Focus on strengthening the entire national ecosystem of quality education and training
roi_benefits: Accelerated skill development and learning efficiency
Improved national workforce competitiveness through enhanced education and training quality
Better informed career and training choices for individuals
Increased employer recognition of skills leading to career progression
primary_users: Employers (for skills recognition and career development)
Government and policy makers (as a statutory board)
